intro: Ruehssia calichicola, commonly known as the pink-flowered rock orchid, is a unique member of the Orchidaceae family native to the mountainous regions of southern China. This plant is characterized by its striking pink and white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers cool, humid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
